original: bsod nams kyis thob pa'i nor bu rin po che rgyan dang bcas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la gtugs shing phyag 'tshal ba la bltas na lhag par yon tan dang ldan zhing mnga' dbang phun sum tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis thob pa'i nor bu rin po che rgyan dang bcas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la gtugs shing phyag 'tshal ba la bltas na lhag par yon tan dang ldan zhing mnga' dbang phun sum tshogs pa'am /
translated: When one sees that the jewel of merit, together with its ornament, touches the feet of the Tathagata and bows to him, one sees that he is endowed with special qualities and has perfect power.

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod cing /üîΩbsnyen bkur byed par 'os pas na /üîΩzhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod cing / bsnyen bkur byed par 'os pas na / zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: He is worthy of worship and service by the world with its gods.

original: zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩHis feet are touched by the crest jewels of Brahma and Indra.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'os shing bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'os shing bstan to //
translated: This is stated in the Indian language.üîΩIt is also suitable to translate it as: The Tathagata's feet touch the crest jewels of Brahma and Indra.

original: yang gcig tu na de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyis tshangs pa dang / dbang po'i gtsug gi nor bu la reg par byas so zhes par rgya gar skad las drang du yang rung ngo //
analyzed: yang gcig tu na de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyis tshangs pa dang / dbang po'i gtsug gi nor bu la reg par byas so zhes par rgya gar skad las drang du yang rung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is also suitable to translate it as: The Tathagata's feet are worthy of being touched by the crest jewels of Brahma and Indra.

original: de ltar na brgya byin dang dbang po la sogs te lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba dang / 'khor mang po dang ldan pas na 'khor phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na brgya byin dang dbang po la sogs te lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba dang / 'khor mang po dang ldan pas na 'khor phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he is endowed with a great retinue, he is said to have the perfect retinue.

original: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha mtha' med rgal ba //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha mtha' med rgal ba //
translated: He has crossed the ocean of suffering, which has no shore.

original: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis ni yon tan phal las khyad zhugs pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis ni yon tan phal las khyad zhugs pa bstan te /
translated: This single verse shows his superiority over ordinary beings.

original: sdug bsngal ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs te sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs te sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la bya'o //
translated: Suffering refers to the three or eight types of suffering, such as birth, aging, and death.

original: yang na las dang tshe dang nyon mongs pa nyid 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pas de nyid sdug bsngal yin par bstan te /
analyzed: yang na las dang tshe dang nyon mongs pa nyid 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pas de nyid sdug bsngal yin par bstan te /
translated: Alternatively, it is taught that karma, life, and afflictions themselves are the causes of cyclic existence, and thus they are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de yang shin tu rgya che zhing mtha' yas pa'i phyir dpe rgya mtsho dang 'dra zhe'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang shin tu rgya che zhing mtha' yas pa'i phyir dpe rgya mtsho dang 'dra zhe'o //
translated: Moreover, since that suffering is extremely vast and limitless, it is likened to an ocean.

original: pha mtha' med pa ni 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: pha mtha' med pa ni 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Having no shore means that cyclic existence has no beginning or end.

original: @7b de lta bu las sus rgal zhe na /
analyzed: @7b de lta bu las sus rgal zhe na /
translated: Who has crossed over such a state?

original: de bzhin gshags pa 'gro ba'i gtso bos rgal te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshags pa 'gro ba'i gtso bos rgal te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, the chief of the world, has crossed over.

original: de bas na brgya byin dang changs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho nyid la gnas pas /
analyzed: de bas na brgya byin dang changs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho nyid la gnas pas /
translated: Therefore, since ≈öakra and BrahmƒÅ remain in the very ocean of suffering,

original: de dag las bcom ldan 'das khyad zhugs pa'i phyir spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dag las bcom ldan 'das khyad zhugs pa'i phyir spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo zhes smos so //
translated: the BhagavƒÅn is superior to them. Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúI pay homage with my head to his feet.‚Äù

original: yang na 'gro ba'i gtso ni skye bo ngan song du 'gro ba las skyob cing dge ba bcu'i chos las blan te /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba'i gtso ni skye bo ngan song du 'gro ba las skyob cing dge ba bcu'i chos las blan te /
translated: Alternatively, the chief of the world protects beings from going to the lower realms and leads them to the ten virtuous dharmas.

original: bde ba'i chos rnams stobs shing thar par 'dren pas na yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan zhing skye ba gzhan la med pas /üîΩ'gro ba'i gtso la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bde ba'i chos rnams stobs shing thar par 'dren pas na yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan zhing skye ba gzhan la med pas / 'gro ba'i gtso la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Since he strengthens the dharmas of happiness and leads them to liberation, he possesses such qualities and does not exist in other births.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúI pay homage to the chief of the world.‚Äù

original: 'di 'dra ba'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can grags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang rin po che'i gter dang 'dra bar 'khor mang po mnga' pa sdug bsngal rgya mtsho las rgal ba yon tan gyi bdag nyid can la phyag 'tshal zhing bstod pa brtsams nas gdod so
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can grags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang rin po che'i gter dang 'dra bar 'khor mang po mnga' pa sdug bsngal rgya mtsho las rgal ba yon tan gyi bdag nyid can la phyag 'tshal zhing bstod pa brtsams nas gdod so
translated: Having paid homage to the one who is endowed with such qualities, who is like a treasure of jewels and who has a great retinue, who has crossed the ocean of suffering, who is endowed with good qualities, and having composed this praise, one should then compose the praise of the Pratimoksha.

original: sor thar pa la bstod pa brtsam mo zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: sor thar pa la bstod pa brtsam mo zhes 'chad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyis phyag 'tshal bal bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyis phyag 'tshal bal bya'o //
translated: In this context, one should pay homage with body, speech and mind.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba yang cir dgongs she na /
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba yang cir dgongs she na /
translated: What is the purpose of paying homage in this way?

original: bla ma la mthu bstan pas bgegs dang bar chad kyis mi zug cing brtsam pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: bla ma la mthu bstan pas bgegs dang bar chad kyis mi zug cing brtsam pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: It is said that by demonstrating one's power to the guru, one will not be harmed by obstacles and hindrances, and one's undertaking will be brought to completion.üîΩIn this regard, some masters say:

original: de la slob dpon kha cig na re snyan pa'i ba dan zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la slob dpon kha cig na re snyan pa'i ba dan zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The banner of fame,

original: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: the crest jewel of Brahma and Indra touching his feet,

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: This is the praise of the Blessed One from the point of view of his perfection of the benefit of others.

original: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha mtha' rgal //üîΩzhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha mtha' rgal // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having crossed the ocean of suffering,üîΩHaving attained the other shore,

original: 'gro ba'i gtso la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the chief of the world.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa la bstod pa'o //
translated: This is the praise of his perfection of his own benefit.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab tshig zhes pa nas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab tshig zhes pa nas /
translated: The words of training of the Omniscient One,

original: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye //
translated: Are to be distinguished in the midst of the assembly of the Noble Ones.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du so sor thar pa la bstod cing bstan par dam bcas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du so sor thar pa la bstod cing bstan par dam bcas pa ste /
translated: This is the praise of the Pratimoksha and the promise to teach it.

original: de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la bstod cing phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la bstod cing phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: Therefore, having praised and paid homage to the Omniscient One, who is perfect in his own and others' benefit,

original: so sor thar pa la bstod cing bstan par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa la bstod cing bstan par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: I will praise the Pratimoksha and teach it.

original: ji ltar na so sor thar pa'i bslab pa'i tshig la bstod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na so sor thar pa'i bslab pa'i tshig la bstod ce na /
translated: How is the word of training of the Pratimoksha to be praised?

original: dkon mchog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is the Jewel,

original: rgya gar skad du ratna zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du ratna zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In Sanskrit, it is called Ratana.üîΩRatana means ‚Äújewel.‚Äù

original: ratna ni rin po che la bya bas rin po'i snod dam rin po @8a * //
analyzed: ratna ni rin po che la bya bas rin po'i snod dam rin po @8a * //
translated: It is a container of jewels or a treasury of jewels that is opened and shown to others.

original: che'i mdzod dbye zhing gzhan la bstan pa yang dper na bya na rin po che la mkhas pa'am rin thang 'debs shes shing sngon chad mthong ba'i mdun du dbye zhing bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: che'i mdzod dbye zhing gzhan la bstan pa yang dper na bya na rin po che la mkhas pa'am rin thang 'debs shes shing sngon chad mthong ba'i mdun du dbye zhing bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: For example, it is opened and shown in the presence of someone who is skilled in jewels or who knows how to appraise them and has seen them before.üîΩBut it is not shown in the presence of someone who has not seen jewels or who does not know about them.

original: rin po che ma mthong ba dang mi shes pa'i mdun du bstan cing phyir zin gyis kyang bzang ngan bye brag mi phyed la /
analyzed: rin po che ma mthong ba dang mi shes pa'i mdun du bstan cing phyir zin gyis kyang bzang ngan bye brag mi phyed la /
translated: Even if they were to see it, they would not be able to distinguish good from bad.

original: cir yang mi mkho ba dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: cir yang mi mkho ba dang mtshungs te /
translated: It would be of no use at all.

original: chos dkon mchog rin po che yang 'phags pa'i gang zag tshul khrims 'di la 'jug cing spyod par 'gyur ba de dag la dbye zhing bstan par bya'o /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog rin po che yang 'phags pa'i gang zag tshul khrims 'di la 'jug cing spyod par 'gyur ba de dag la dbye zhing bstan par bya'o /
translated: The precious jewel of the Dharma should also be opened and shown to those noble beings who engage in and practice this discipline.

original: de la mi 'jug pa'i gang zag kun la bstan kyang dgos pa med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la mi 'jug pa'i gang zag kun la bstan kyang dgos pa med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes smos te /
translated: Although it is taught to all persons who do not enter it, there is no need for it. Therefore, it should be divided in the midst of the assembly of the noble ones.

original: des ni so sor thar pa'i bslab tshig la bstod cing dam bcas pa'o //
analyzed: des ni so sor thar pa'i bslab tshig la bstod cing dam bcas pa'o //
translated: By this, the words of training in the pratimoksha are praised and promised.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni gong ma 'dra /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni gong ma 'dra /
translated: Omniscience is as above.

original: des bstan pas na bslab pa tshul khrims de ni bslab tshig go //
analyzed: des bstan pas na bslab pa tshul khrims de ni bslab tshig go //
translated: Since it is taught by that, the training of morality is the words of training.

original: dkon mchog ni bslab tshig de dkon zhing mchog dam pa yin pas na dkon mchog go //
analyzed: dkon mchog ni bslab tshig de dkon zhing mchog dam pa yin pas na dkon mchog go //
translated: The jewel is the words of training, because it is rare and supreme.

original: snod dang 'dra ste rnam par dbye ba dang / dngos po la sogs pa'i gzhi'am gnas su gyur ba'i phyir so so thar pa ni snod ces smos so //
analyzed: snod dang 'dra ste rnam par dbye ba dang / dngos po la sogs pa'i gzhi'am gnas su gyur ba'i phyir so so thar pa ni snod ces smos so //
translated: The pratimoksha is said to be like a vessel, because it is the basis or abode of things such as division.

original: de yan chad sangs rgyas la bstod pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yan chad sangs rgyas la bstod pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: From here on, it is connected with the praise of the Buddha.

original: 'di man chad chos la bstod pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di man chad chos la bstod pa dang sbyar te /
translated: From here on, it is connected with the praise of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni 'dul ba mtsho //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni 'dul ba mtsho //
translated: The Buddha's Vinaya is an ocean.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on is said.

original: de la sangs rgyas ni ma rig pa'i gnyid las sangs shing mkhyen par bgyi ba'i spyod yul la pad mo kha rgyas pa bzhin du rgyas pa la bya /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas ni ma rig pa'i gnyid las sangs shing mkhyen par bgyi ba'i spyod yul la pad mo kha rgyas pa bzhin du rgyas pa la bya /
translated: Buddha means that one has awakened from the sleep of ignorance and that one has expanded like a lotus flower in the field of knowledge.

original: yang na rgya rgar skad du rgyas zhes bya ba'i nyi tshe'i sgra yod de /
analyzed: yang na rgya rgar skad du rgyas zhes bya ba'i nyi tshe'i sgra yod de /
translated: Or, in the language of the Rgyal-rong, it means to expand.

original: sgrib pa rnams yongs su byang nas /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams yongs su byang nas /
translated: Having completely purified the obscurations,

original: mkhyen par bya ba'i yul la mig dang 'dra ba'i ye shes kyi gsal zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas par zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: mkhyen par bya ba'i yul la mig dang 'dra ba'i ye shes kyi gsal zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas par zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: one expands and becomes clear like the eye of pristine cognition in the field of knowledge.

original: kyi zhes bya ba ni dgar ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: kyi zhes bya ba ni dgar ba'i tshig ste /
translated: The word kyi is a particle of separation.

original: mu stegs can gtogs 'dod pa la sogs pa'i ma yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi 'dul ba mtsho dang 'dra'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mu stegs can gtogs 'dod pa la sogs pa'i ma yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi 'dul ba mtsho dang 'dra'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it is not the Vinaya of the tirthikas, the Vaibhasikas, etc., but the Vinaya of the Buddha which is like an ocean.

original: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang ma mo dag las khyad par du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang ma mo dag las khyad par du bstan pa'o //
translated: Vinaya is taught as a special subject in the Sutras and the Vinaya.

original: yang na yon tan gyi sgo nas 'dul ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang na yon tan gyi sgo nas 'dul ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Or, it is called Vinaya because of its good qualities.

original: kun nas bskor ba'i nyon mongs pa 'don zhing 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas bskor ba'i nyon mongs pa 'don zhing 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba'o //
translated: It is the Vinaya because it expels and tames the afflictions that surround it.

original: yang na 'dod chags dang / @8b zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gnyen por 'gyur te 'dul bas na 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags dang / @8b zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gnyen por 'gyur te 'dul bas na 'dul ba'o //
translated: Or, it is the Vinaya because it becomes the antidote to attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: 'o na 'di lta bu'i 'dul ba'i le'u mang nyung ji tsam cig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di lta bu'i 'dul ba'i le'u mang nyung ji tsam cig yod ce na /
translated: Well then, how many chapters of Vinaya are there?

original: tshad bzung zhing dpag dka' bar bstan pas dpe rgya mtsho dang 'dra'o zhes so //
analyzed: tshad bzung zhing dpag dka' bar bstan pas dpe rgya mtsho dang 'dra'o zhes so //
translated: It is taught that it is difficult to measure and so it is like the ocean.

original: mtsho dang 'dra bar bstan pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'o /
analyzed: mtsho dang 'dra bar bstan pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'o /
translated: It is taught to be like the ocean in terms of its profundity and vastness.

original: yang na ji ltar na mtsho las nor bu rin po che 'byung ba ltar tshul khrims 'dul ba'i gzhi las yon tan gyi 'bras bu yid bzhin du 'byung bas na mtsho dang 'dra'o zhes /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar na mtsho las nor bu rin po che 'byung ba ltar tshul khrims 'dul ba'i gzhi las yon tan gyi 'bras bu yid bzhin du 'byung bas na mtsho dang 'dra'o zhes /
translated: Or, just as a precious jewel comes from the ocean, so too the results of qualities come from the basis of the Vinaya of ethical discipline, just as one wishes.

original: ma lus zhes smos pa ni 'og nas 'grel te /
analyzed: ma lus zhes smos pa ni 'og nas 'grel te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin its entirety‚Äù is explained below.

original: gting dang pha rol du med par gnas dang snying gi snying po zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gting dang pha rol du med par gnas dang snying gi snying po zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: It is connected with ‚Äúthe essence of the heart‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout depth or far shore.‚Äù

original: gting dang pha rol med pa ni mtsho de ji ltar gting dpag dka' zhing pha rol med pa ltar 'dul ba yang tshad gzung dka' ba'i phyir ro /üîΩpha rol med pa ni 'di ni pha rol to //
analyzed: gting dang pha rol med pa ni mtsho de ji ltar gting dpag dka' zhing pha rol med pa ltar 'dul ba yang tshad gzung dka' ba'i phyir ro / pha rol med pa ni 'di ni pha rol to //
translated: Similarly, it is difficult to measure the extent of the training.

original: 'di ni tshul rol to zhes bsnyad pa dang mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'dul ba yang 'di ni thog ma'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul rol to zhes bsnyad pa dang mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir te / 'dul ba yang 'di ni thog ma'i mtha'o //
translated: It has no far shore, because it is not possible to say or see that this is the far shore or this is the near shore.

original: 'di ni tha ma'i mtha'o zhes tshad mi zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni tha ma'i mtha'o zhes tshad mi zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The training also has no beginning or end, because it is impossible to say that this is the beginning or this is the end.

original: yang na 'dul ba'i yon tan de ltar dpag cing tshad gzung ba'am gzhal bar bya ba la yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dul ba'i yon tan de ltar dpag cing tshad gzung ba'am gzhal bar bya ba la yang bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is said that the training is to be measured or evaluated in terms of the qualities of the training.

original: gnas dang snying gi snying po ni 'dul ba ma lus pa zhes 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnas dang snying gi snying po ni 'dul ba ma lus pa zhes 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The heart essence of the training is to be connected here with the phrase the abode of all the trainings.üîΩAll refers to the divisions, the entities, the minute particles, and so on.

original: ma lus pa ni rnam par dbye ba dang / dngos po dang / phran tsheg la sogs pa de dag ma lus pa'i gnas sam /
analyzed: ma lus pa ni rnam par dbye ba dang / dngos po dang / phran tsheg la sogs pa de dag ma lus pa'i gnas sam /
translated: The training is the abode of all of them, because it is the basis of all of them.üîΩOr else, the training is the body of all of them, because it is the object of the recollection of the trainings.

original: lus dran par gyur bas na de bas na so sor thar pa ni gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dran par gyur bas na de bas na so sor thar pa ni gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore the training is called the abode.

original: snying dang zhes bya ba ni dam pa lta bu'i dpe ste /
analyzed: snying dang zhes bya ba ni dam pa lta bu'i dpe ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the heart‚Äù is an example of something precious.

original: dper na lus kyi nang na dam pa ni snying ngo //
analyzed: dper na lus kyi nang na dam pa ni snying ngo //
translated: For example, in the body, the heart is the most precious.

analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'dul ba thams cad kyi snying du gyur ba'am /

analyzed: ji ltar ra bas bskor ba'i grong sgo bsdoms shing bcas pa la dgras 'jigs pa dang bral ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong yang /

analyzed: yang na them skas kyi dpes na ji ltar 'jig rten na rim par 'gro ba la them skas btsugs te 'gro bar bya ste /

analyzed: de ni phyin par bya ba'i thabs su dgos so zhe'o //

original: 'dul ba de la brten cing gnas pa de dag kyang mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gnas su phyin par yang 'gyur la mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer du phyin par byed pa'i thabs ni so sor thar pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: Those who rely on and abide in that discipline will also go to the state of nirvana, and the means of going to the city of nirvana is the pratimoksha. This is the meaning.

analyzed: nga mya ngan las 'das pa'o 'og tu sa sor thar pa ni @12b ston par ltos shig / dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni gnas brtan gyis shig / gang zag mi srun pa ni mi smra bar 'dul zhing lan lon cig / mdo sde'i mgo la ni

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bris shig / da 'dug pa'i tshe bya ba dang mi bya bar bstan pa rnams de de bzhin du byas na nga 'dug pa dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs so //

translated: When you are sitting, if you do as I have taught you about what should and should not be done, it will be as if I were sitting there.

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'am 'khor ba las rgal ba la bya'o //

analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi ni 'dul ba mtsho //

original: zhes bya ba man chad nas /

translated: From here up to

translated: the hook of the young elephant,

translated: this is connected with the result of seeing.üîΩFrom here up to the four steps,

translated: The term having practiced means that one practices and acts with body, speech, and mind for the sake of that.

analyzed: 'dzin pa bas kyang nyams su len cing sgrub par byed pa ches dka' ste shin tu dkon no zhes bstan to //

analyzed: mang du thos pa ni the tshom sel zhing bden pa rtogs pa dang / dogs pa rnams med par byed pas mang du thos pa mthong na bde'o zhe'o //
translated: It is good to see the learned, because they dispel doubt, realize the truth, and remove uncertainty.

original: 'di ni lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the members of insight.

original: de la skabs 'dir tshul khrims kyi nang du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi cha gnyis ka med dam zhes zer yang srid de /üîΩde ni zhi gnas kyi nang na lhag mthong yod /
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir tshul khrims kyi nang du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi cha gnyis ka med dam zhes zer yang srid de / de ni zhi gnas kyi nang na lhag mthong yod /
translated: In this context, it is possible to ask whether or not both the aspects of calm abiding and insight are included in morality.üîΩAlthough insight is included in calm abiding,

original: lhag mthong gi nang na'ang zhi gnas yod mod kyi /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi nang na'ang zhi gnas yod mod kyi /
translated: and calm abiding is included in insight,

original: shas che chung gi phyir dbye ba tsam du zad de /
analyzed: shas che chung gi phyir dbye ba tsam du zad de /
translated: the distinction is made merely on the basis of their relative predominance.

original: de la zhi gnas ni g-yeng ba zhi ba'i tshul khrims kyang mi rgod mi 'phyar ba'i rang bzhin te zhi ba shas che bas zhi gnas kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas ni g-yeng ba zhi ba'i tshul khrims kyang mi rgod mi 'phyar ba'i rang bzhin te zhi ba shas che bas zhi gnas kyis bstan to //
translated: Calm abiding is a morality in which distraction is pacified, and it is by nature not agitated or disturbed. Since it is predominantly calm, it is taught as calm abiding.

original: mang du thos pa ni thos pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: mang du thos pa ni thos pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Learning is the wisdom of listening.

original: shes pa shas che bas na lhag mthong gis bstan te /
analyzed: shes pa shas che bas na lhag mthong gis bstan te /
translated: Since it is predominantly knowledge, it is taught as insight.

original: yan lag la gnas zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mthar rdzogs par ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag la gnas zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mthar rdzogs par ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase abiding in the branches means that calm abiding and insight have not yet been perfected.

original: de la don dam pa'i dge ba'i bshas gnyen la yang zhi gnas kyi mtha' la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi mtha' la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i dge ba'i bshas gnyen la yang zhi gnas kyi mtha' la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi mtha' la gnas pa'o //
translated: The ultimate spiritual teacher is also twofold: one who abides in the culmination of serenity and one who abides in the culmination of insight.

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra ni phyir zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra ni phyir zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Liberated from rebirth means that the word ‚Äúagain‚Äù means ‚Äúback.‚Äù

original: srid pa ni khams gsum la bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni khams gsum la bya'o //
translated: Existence refers to the three realms.

original: @16a * // de bas na phyir srid par 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bas na yang srid par rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @16a * // de bas na phyir srid par 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bas na yang srid par rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one who is liberated from rebirth is liberated from the afflictions that lead to rebirth.

original: rnam par grol ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa'i phung po nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa las rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig yin te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa'i phung po nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa las rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig yin te /
translated: Liberation means being liberated from the bondage of the afflictions of the appropriated aggregates that possess defilements.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dgra bcom pa dag mthong na bde zhes 'byung ba de nyid de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag mthong na bde zhes 'byung ba de nyid de /
translated: It is the statement, ‚ÄúWhen seeing arhats, one is happy.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rnam par grol ba ni dgra bcom pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par grol ba ni dgra bcom pa zhes gdags so //
translated: Such liberation is designated as an arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pas dgra bcom pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pas dgra bcom pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: The Arhat is also called the destroyer of the enemy of the defilements.

original: phyir skye ba dang 'byung ba med pas /
analyzed: phyir skye ba dang 'byung ba med pas /
translated: Because he does not return to a new birth and does not arise again,

original: rgya gar gyi skad kyis 'byung ba med pa /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi skad kyis 'byung ba med pa /
translated: in the Indian language he is called an an-utpada.

original: skye ba med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: He is also called an a-utpatti.

original: yang na mchod par 'os pa ste /
analyzed: yang na mchod par 'os pa ste /
translated: Or else, he is worthy of offerings,

original: yon gyi gnas su gyur cing dad pa dang / ma dad pas byin pa'i zas dang gos zhu bar 'gyur ba'i dgra bcom pas dgra bcom pa zhe 'am /
analyzed: yon gyi gnas su gyur cing dad pa dang / ma dad pas byin pa'i zas dang gos zhu bar 'gyur ba'i dgra bcom pas dgra bcom pa zhe 'am /
translated: having become a field of merit, and he is an Arhat who consumes the food and clothing given by the faithful and the faithless.

original: mchod par 'os pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par 'os pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is also called worthy of offerings.

original: de lta bu'i skyes bu dam pa yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba mthong ba bde'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i skyes bu dam pa yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba mthong ba bde'o zhe'o //
translated: Thus, it is good to see such a holy person, who is great in the nature of his virtues.

original: de yan chad kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten par bya ba dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po spong ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten par bya ba dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po spong ba bshad zin to //
translated: Up to this point, it has been explained how to rely on a spiritual friend and how to avoid bad friends.

original: da ni rnam pa bdun po las 'bras bu thob pa bstan te /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa bdun po las 'bras bu thob pa bstan te /
translated: Now, the attainment of the result through the seven aspects is taught.

original: de yang gang gi rgyus thob ce na /
analyzed: de yang gang gi rgyus thob ce na /
translated: And by what cause is it attained?

original: sngar bstan pa'i dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob po zhe'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob po zhe'o //
translated: The result of liberation is attained by relying on the spiritual friend who is the source of the three jewels taught above.

original: de la rnam par grol ba nyid ci lta bu yin pa bstan par 'dod na dper na /
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba nyid ci lta bu yin pa bstan par 'dod na dper na /
translated: If one wishes to demonstrate what liberation itself is like, it is taught:

original: 'bab stegs bde ba'i chu klung bde //üîΩzhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'bab stegs bde ba'i chu klung bde // zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: A river is pleasant to cross when it has a pleasant ford.

original: ci ltar chu bo chen po las rgal bar 'dod na chu 'gram na nyam nga ba med cing /
analyzed: ci ltar chu bo chen po las rgal bar 'dod na chu 'gram na nyam nga ba med cing /
translated: If one wishes to cross a great river, the riverbank should be free of danger,

original: grog po dang / tsher gad dang / rdo la sogs pa med pa na chu 'gram nyid kyang bde ba yin la /
analyzed: grog po dang / tsher gad dang / rdo la sogs pa med pa na chu 'gram nyid kyang bde ba yin la /
translated: without ravines, thorns, rocks, and so on. The riverbank itself is pleasant.

original: de rgal ba'i mi dang chu bo 'bab pa nyid kyang shin tu bde ba yin te /
analyzed: de rgal ba'i mi dang chu bo 'bab pa nyid kyang shin tu bde ba yin te /
translated: The person who crosses it and the flowing river are also very pleasant.

original: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa dang / rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i dri ma'i mu dang bral ba de ni 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa dang / rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i dri ma'i mu dang bral ba de ni 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the view of existence and nonexistence, of eternalism and nihilism, is free from the extremes of stains. That is called the noble path.

original: chu 'gram bde ba'i lam bzang po dang 'dra bar mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i chos rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob pa de ni shin tu bde bar bstan to //
analyzed: chu 'gram bde ba'i lam bzang po dang 'dra bar mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i chos rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob pa de ni shin tu bde bar bstan to //
translated: The result of liberation of the dharmas obtained by the ƒÅrya path free from all extremes is taught to be extremely blissful, like a good, easy path to the river.

original: chos las rgyal ba'i skye bo bde //
analyzed: chos las rgyal ba'i skye bo bde //
translated: The person who is victorious over the dharmas is happy.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'phags pa'i lam la gnas shing @16b rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nag po'i chos rnams sel zhing rgyal bar byas pas na chos las rgyal ba'i skye bo bde'o zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'phags pa'i lam la gnas shing @16b rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu thob pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nag po'i chos rnams sel zhing rgyal bar byas pas na chos las rgyal ba'i skye bo bde'o zhe'o //
translated: Thus, by abiding in the ƒÅrya path and obtaining the result of liberation, the person who is victorious over the dharmas, who eliminates and conquers the opposing class of dark dharmas, is happy.

original: don de nyid phyed 'og nas ston te //
analyzed: don de nyid phyed 'og nas ston te //
translated: This meaning is taught in the second half:

original: nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and pride is happiness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa'i shes rab kyi ral gris mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms shing gcod par byed pa ni shes rab yin te shes rab med par nyon mongs pa spong bar mi nus pas de'i phyir shes rab thob pa bde'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa'i shes rab kyi ral gris mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms shing gcod par byed pa ni shes rab yin te shes rab med par nyon mongs pa spong bar mi nus pas de'i phyir shes rab thob pa bde'o zhe'o //
translated: Wisdom is what cuts and destroys the opposing side with the sword of wisdom that has not obtained the noble path. Since without wisdom it is not possible to abandon the afflictions, therefore it is said that obtaining wisdom is happiness.

original: de bas rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: de bas rgyu bstan te /
translated: Thus the cause is taught.

original: ji ltar shes rab thob pa bde zhe na /üîΩnga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab thob pa bde zhe na / nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde //
translated: How is it that obtaining wisdom is happiness?

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe exhaustion of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and pride is happiness.‚Äù

original: nga'o nga rgyal yang shes rab kyi ral gris yongs su gcod par nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nga'o nga rgyal yang shes rab kyi ral gris yongs su gcod par nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Pride is also able to be completely cut by the sword of wisdom, but not by others.

original: shes rab thob pa bde zhe'o //
analyzed: shes rab thob pa bde zhe'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that obtaining wisdom is happiness.

original: de'i skabs su nga'o nga rgyal zad ces mi bya bar 'dod chags la sogs pa zad ces smras na ci nyes zhes zer yang srid de /
analyzed: de'i skabs su nga'o nga rgyal zad ces mi bya bar 'dod chags la sogs pa zad ces smras na ci nyes zhes zer yang srid de /
translated: At that time, if one says, ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with saying the exhaustion of attachment and so on instead of the exhaustion of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and pride?‚Äù

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: That is not a fault.

original: nga rgyal ni nyon mongs pa thams cad skyed pa'i phyir rtsa ba 'am gzhi lta bu yin pas de bcad pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa yang mi 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni nyon mongs pa thams cad skyed pa'i phyir rtsa ba 'am gzhi lta bu yin pas de bcad pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa yang mi 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since pride is like a root or basis because it generates all the afflictions, it should be understood that when it is cut, attachment and so on will not occur.

original: de ltar yang 'dod chags la sogs pa yang nga dang nga yi ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi zhes pa'i bsam pa ngan pa las byung nas bdag la chags pa skye zhing pha rol gyi phyogs la zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dod chags la sogs pa yang nga dang nga yi ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi zhes pa'i bsam pa ngan pa las byung nas bdag la chags pa skye zhing pha rol gyi phyogs la zhe sdang ste /
translated: Thus, attachment and so on also arise from the evil thoughts of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù Attachment to self arises and aversion to the other side arises.

original: de gnyis byung ba dang de'i las gti mug kyang 'byung ba yin bas nga rgyal chod dang gzhan lta zhig zlas mi gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis byung ba dang de'i las gti mug kyang 'byung ba yin bas nga rgyal chod dang gzhan lta zhig zlas mi gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since delusion also arises from the arising of those two, it should be understood that when pride is cut, the other two do not remain together.

original: de'i phyir nga rgyal zad pa bde ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga rgyal zad pa bde ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the exhaustion of pride is happiness.

original: de yan chad du 'bras bu thob pa bde ba bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yan chad du 'bras bu thob pa bde ba bstan zin to //
translated: Up to this point, the happiness of attaining the result has been explained.

original: da ni 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas bstan te /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas bstan te /
translated: Now, the place of attaining the result will be explained.

original: nges par byas zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan can rnams kyi thog ma'i dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: nges par byas zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan can rnams kyi thog ma'i dag pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving made a commitment‚Äù indicates the initial purity of those who possess the spiritual training.

original: dgon pa la gnas par bya bar yang nus na ni bya /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas par bya bar yang nus na ni bya /
translated: If one is able to live in the forest, one should do so.

original: mi nus na ni gtong ngam zhe 'am /
analyzed: mi nus na ni gtong ngam zhe 'am /
translated: If one is not able to do so, should one give up the commitment?

original: bdag gis ci tsam nus pa ni bya /
analyzed: bdag gis ci tsam nus pa ni bya /
translated: One should do what one is able to do.üîΩIf one is not able to do that, one should give it up.

original: de ma yin na ni gtong zhes dam bca' ba'i dgon pa can ni dag pa'i bsam pa can ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ma yin na ni gtong zhes dam bca' ba'i dgon pa can ni dag pa'i bsam pa can ma yin pas /
translated: One who has made a commitment to live in the forest but who lacks a pure attitude is not a pure forest dweller.

original: gang ji tsam du bdag gi don yongs su ma rdzogs par mi btang mi ldog par dam bcas pa dang / yi dam nges par bya ba de ni bsam pa dag pa yin pas nges par bya ba ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang ji tsam du bdag gi don yongs su ma rdzogs par mi btang mi ldog par dam bcas pa dang / yi dam nges par bya ba de ni bsam pa dag pa yin pas nges par bya ba ni de lta bu'o //
translated: The purity of attitude is such that one does not give up or turn back from the commitment to do what one is able to do, and to do what one has committed to do.

original: @17a * // dbang po thul ba ni dbang po mi rgod cing mi 'phyar mi g-yeng ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: @17a * // dbang po thul ba ni dbang po mi rgod cing mi 'phyar mi g-yeng ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: One who has controlled the senses is not one whose senses are agitated, excited, or distracted.

original: zhi ba bcings pa de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: zhi ba bcings pa de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúbound by peace.‚Äù

original: dngos su na 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems mi 'brang ba de nyid dbang po thul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su na 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems mi 'brang ba de nyid dbang po thul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In fact, one who does not pursue the objects of the five senses is said to have ‚Äúcontrolled the senses.‚Äù

original: mang du thos pa dgon pa zhi rnams zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa bstan pa 'jig pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mang du thos pa dgon pa zhi rnams zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa bstan pa 'jig pa gnyis te /
translated: The phrase the learned are those who dwell in peace in the forest means that the doctrine of the Bhagavan is destroyed by two things.

original: mang du thos pa grong na gnas pa dang / nyung du thos pa dgon pa na gnas pa zhes 'byung bas 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang du thos pa grong na gnas pa dang / nyung du thos pa dgon pa na gnas pa zhes 'byung bas 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The learned are destroyed by dwelling in towns, and the unlearned are destroyed by dwelling in the forest.

original: dgon pa na gnas pa yang tshul khrims lci yang dang gso sbyong gi bye brag dang / mdo sde'i gnas shes pa gnas par bya'i gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas pa yang tshul khrims lci yang dang gso sbyong gi bye brag dang / mdo sde'i gnas shes pa gnas par bya'i gzhan ma yin /
translated: Those who dwell in the forest should know the distinctions of the heaviness and lightness of moral discipline and the distinctions of the purification ceremony and the topics of the sutras, but not others.

original: nyung du thos pa dgon par gnas pa mi rigs pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyung du thos pa dgon par gnas pa mi rigs pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the unlearned are destroyed by dwelling in the forest means that it is not proper for them to dwell in the forest.

original: dgon pa ni rgyang grags gcig phan chad do //
analyzed: dgon pa ni rgyang grags gcig phan chad do //
translated: The forest is one kro≈õa beyond the village.

original: zhi ba ni 'jigs pa dang dogs pa dang / nyam nga ba'i sa ma yin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni 'jigs pa dang dogs pa dang / nyam nga ba'i sa ma yin pa la bya'o //
translated: Peace is a place free from fear, danger, and terror.

original: 'jigs pa ni dgras 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni dgras 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fear is fear of enemies.

original: dogs pa ni gcan gzan gyis 'tshe bar dogs pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gcan gzan gyis 'tshe bar dogs pa'o //
translated: Danger is the danger of being harmed by wild animals.

original: nyam nga ba ni sbrang bu la sogs pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: nyam nga ba ni sbrang bu la sogs pa yod pa'o //
translated: Terror is the presence of mosquitoes and so on.

original: de dag med pa'i gnas su dgon pa bca' bar bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dul ba las gsol ba dang las kyis gang zag cig bskos te /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i gnas su dgon pa bca' bar bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dul ba las gsol ba dang las kyis gang zag cig bskos te /
translated: One should build a monastery in a place that lacks these, as the Vinaya declares:

original: dgon pa'i gnas rtogs shig ces 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas rtogs shig ces 'byung ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAppoint a person by means of a proposal and a single action, and have him search for a place for the monastery.‚Äù

original: gnas par gyur pa nags su rgas pa bde //
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa nags su rgas pa bde //
translated: It is happy to grow old in the forest,üîΩhaving become a forest dweller.

original: zhes pa / gnas par gyur na ni thog ma'i bsam pa nges pa la bya ste gnas phan chad 'di ltar gnas la me tog rgas shing rang lhags su gnas pa dang 'dra bas ches btags te gnas par bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa / gnas par gyur na ni thog ma'i bsam pa nges pa la bya ste gnas phan chad 'di ltar gnas la me tog rgas shing rang lhags su gnas pa dang 'dra bas ches btags te gnas par bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: If one has become a forest dweller, one should be certain about the original intention, and one should live in the forest for the rest of one‚Äôs life, as if one were a flower that grows in the forest and withers there.

original: yang gcig tu na dgon pa'i nags su rgas par gyur gyi bar du gnas par bya'o zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang gcig tu na dgon pa'i nags su rgas par gyur gyi bar du gnas par bya'o zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, one should live in the forest until one grows old.

original: de la nags 'ba' zhig dgon pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de la nags 'ba' zhig dgon pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is only a forest a wilderness?

original: de ni nyi tshe ba'i mtshan nyid tsam du zad kyi grong dang rgyang grags gcig phan chad gzhan yang 'di dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyi tshe ba'i mtshan nyid tsam du zad kyi grong dang rgyang grags gcig phan chad gzhan yang 'di dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
